docs.lead_paragraph: As a resident of New York State who has lived under the divine guidance of Saint Mario Cuomo for too many years, I would caution the newly canonized Saint Hillary against trying to force her beliefs on the people of this country.

docs.lead_paragraph: ZURICH, Switzerland, Oct. 24--Glacier experts from this little country of big glaciers are investigating the changing weather of the world with a new research tool.
docs.abstract: Meteorologists use radiation counter invented by Dr Oaschger to date and measure historic weather cycles as shown by age and thickness of successive layers of ice in Swiss glaciers; hope record will enable long-range forecasts; detector to be used in French-Ger-Danish-Swiss IGY study of Greenland

byline.original: By JOHN HILLARY Special to The New York Times

headline.main: ATOMIC COUNTER AIDS IN ICE STUDY; New Oaschger Unit Shows Weather That Hit Glaciers of 60,000 Years Ago Indicator of Radiation To Be Used in Greenland Device Measures Tritium

docs.snippet: ZURICH, Switzerland, Oct. 24--Glacier experts from this little country of big glaciers are investigating the changing weather of the world with a new research tool....

docs.lead_paragraph: Politics | A columnist compares John McCain's campaigning not just to "spastic-goat rodeos" but to Hillary Clinton's failed run. Like her, McCain "seems to encourage an atmosphere of anarchy" and "finds it difficult to fire anyone." One difference not mentioned: Bill. [New York]

docs.lead_paragraph: We are really tired of hearing William Safire hit at the Clintons as a means of atoning for his not supporting George Bush (On Language: "Hillary Speaks," Oct. 1). His carping at the First Lady's talk in China is a new low in nit-picking.

docs.lead_paragraph: When Safire, the father of "nattering nabobs of negativism," can't criticize content, he becomes a grumpy grammarian groping for grist for griping. MILTON F. SHORE Silver Spring, Md.

docs.lead_paragraph: I believe that we all respond better to leadership by example than to sermons. The Clinton Administration already is showing signs of being tarnished by an image of sloppiness, if not moral laxity, so lectures from the First Lady about individual and group behavior invite accusations of hypocrisy.

docs.lead_paragraph: I am not worried about Mrs. Clinton's moral judgment becoming a basis for Governmental policy. That's hardly likely. But I would consider the country lucky if her values became as influential in the 1990's as Ronald Reagan's were in the 1980's. AURORA HUDSON New York, N.Y.
docs.snippet: I am not worried about Mrs. Clinton's moral judgment becoming a basis for Governmental policy. That's hardly likely. But I would consider the country lucky if her values became as influential in the 1990's as Ronald Reagan's were in the 1980's. AU...

docs.lead_paragraph: After 12 years of moral certitude from Pat Robertson, Jerry Falwell, Dan Quayle, et al, I am exhilarated by Mrs. Clinton's willingness to say, "I don't know." The Founding Fathers cared deeply about the politics of virtue. Thomas Jefferson defined virtue as "a love of others, a sense of duty to them, a moral instinct, in short, which prompts us irresistibly to feel and to succor their distresses." All of which sounds pretty "fuzzy," to use the pejorative Michael Kelly applies to Mrs. Clinton.
